casebody.data:
Sidenstricker, Appellee, v. Miller Pavement Maintenance, Inc., Appellant.

[Cite as Sidenstricker v. Miller Pavement Maintenance, Inc., 110 Ohio St.3d 1258, 2006-Ohio-4203.]

(No. 2004-1739 Submitted November 8, 2005 Decided August 16, 2006.) Ferron & Associates, L.P.A., John W. Ferron, Leslie Blair Graden, and Lisa A. Wafer, for appellee. Buckingham, Doolittle & Burroughs, L.L.P., and Jan E. Hensel, for appellant. Schottenstein, Zox & Dunn and Roger L. Sabo, urging reversal for amici curiae Ohio Contractors Association, Flexible Pavements, Inc., and Builders Exchange of Central Ohio. Gittes & Schulte, Frederick M. Gittes, and Kathaleen B. Schulte, urging affirmance for amicus curiae Ohio Employment Lawyers Association.

{¶ 1} The cause is dismissed, sua sponte, as having been improvidently accepted.

{¶ 2} The court orders that the opinion of the court of appeals may not be cited as authority except by the parties inter se.

Moyer, C.J., Resnick, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O’Connor, O’Donnell and Lanzinger, JJ., concur.
